Problem:
We consider a linear system governed by the differential equation \\(\\dot{x} = Ax\\) where A is a constant matrix. The system is subjected to an integral transform defined by \\( g(x) = \\int_0^t e^{B\\tau}x(\\tau) d\\tau \\), where B is also a constant matrix.

Given the state \\( x(T) \\) obtained at time T, can it be unequivocally traced back to the original state \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0 before \\( g(x) \\) was applied, without knowing whether the transformation was utilized?
Explanation: Without confirmation whether \\( g(x) \\) was applied, there is ambiguity in the initial condition due to the convolution with \\( e^{B\\tau} \\). Since the transformation can modify \\( x_0 \\) in various ways dependent on B, decoding \\( x_0 \\) purely from \\( x(T) \\) is not retrievable.
